Sentencas: Oxygen ion conductivities of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2 are important for their solid oxide full cell applications.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: A quantitative model accounting for the widely observed grain size dependence of the conductivity is of significant interest.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: A concise model for the grain size dependence of Schottky barrier is proposed here.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: The model is deduced from a continuum model for curvature effect on defect formation energy and its modification by considering the discrete nature of lattice distortion.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: The model is in good agreement with experiments for grain size effect on the Schottky barrier height and the grain boundary conductivity of doped ZrO2 and CeO2.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: The model is combined with the brick layer model to systematically examine the size and temperature dependences of total ionic conductivities of doped ZrO2 and CeO2.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2

Sentencas: The total conductivity decreases monotonically with grain size at high temperature, but shows a maximum at about 200 nm at low temperature.
Titulo: A Schottky barrier based model for the grain size effect on oxygen ion conductivity of acceptor-doped ZrO2 and CeO2
